page.title: 07A HOSPITAL VISIT
page.content: In the ward there were only 6 patients as the rest were on a days outing to Worthing. One of the patients surprised me because she was allergic to sunshine, lying curled up on uer bed with a blind to shelter her from the sun.She couldn't talk but was happy when people came and talked to her. Some beds were just mattresses on the floor with large teddy bears beside them as many of the children tend to fall out of bed. The wards are brightly coloured with painted pictures of the seaside on the windows.Outside are play areas with climbing frames, sandpits and other playthings. At the swimming pool a special crane lifts the children into the contuously heated water. We saw a little boy held by two nurses trying to move his limbs in the water.
